River trolls appear when attempting to fish in the Enchanted Valley. If Swan Song has been completed, the troll will burst out of the water saying that the player killed the Sea Troll Queen before attacking.

Despite being considered a troll for the purposes of a slayer task, they give very little experience and therefore not recommended to be slain for a slayer task.

Contents

  • 1 History
  • 2 Drops
    • 2.1 Materials
    • 2.2 Bait
    • 2.3 Other
  • 3 Changes

History[edit | edit source]

Before the random event update in 2014, the river troll used to appear randomly when attempting to fish. On appearance, it would say "Fishies be mine, leave dem fishies!". As with similar guardian random events, the river troll's combat level and stats scaled with the player's combat level, as well as only being attackable by the targeted player.

As with all other aggressive random events, it was removed in an update.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 2,712 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
29 March 2004
(update)

The NPC was permanently added with the launch of RuneScape 2.

2 February 2004
(update)

The NPC was added to the RuneScape 2 Beta.

'''River trolls''' appear when attempting to [[fishing spot|fish]] in the [[Enchanted Valley]]. If [[Swan Song]] has been completed, the troll will burst out of the water saying that the player killed the [[Sea Troll Queen]] before attacking.

Despite being considered a [[troll]] for the purposes of a [[slayer task]], they give very little experience and therefore not recommended to be slain for a slayer task.

==History==
Before the [[random events|random event]] update in [[2014]], the river troll used to appear randomly when attempting to fish. On appearance, it would say "Fishies be mine, leave dem fishies!". As with similar guardian random events, the river troll's [[combat level]] and stats scaled with the player's combat level, as well as only being attackable by the targeted player.

As with all other aggressive random events, it was removed in an [[Update:Optional Randoms & Goblins|update]].
